@graph.headline: Texas Employment Law Guide for Small Businesses (2025-2026)
@graph.description: Expert guide to Texas employment law for Houston small businesses covering at-will employment, wage laws, TCHRA protections, workers' compensation, and 2025 compliance requirements.

mainEntity.name: Can I fire an employee for any reason in Texas?

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, under at-will employment. However, you cannot fire for illegal reasons (discrimination, retaliation, refusing illegal acts). Document legitimate business reasons for all terminations.

mainEntity.name: How quickly must I pay an employee their final check?

acceptedAnswer.text: Within 6 calendar days if you terminate them. If they quit, by the next regular payday. Failure to comply can result in TWC claims.

mainEntity.name: Does my small business need workers' compensation insurance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Noâ€”Texas is the only state where it's optional. However, non-subscribers face full legal liability in workplace injury lawsuits with no damage caps.

mainEntity.name: What workplace posters are required in Texas?

acceptedAnswer.text: Both Texas state posters (minimum wage, unemployment, workers' comp notice) and federal posters (EEOC, FLSA, OSHA). Purchase an all-in-one 2026 poster for full compliance.

mainEntity.name: When do Texas anti-discrimination laws apply to my business?

acceptedAnswer.text: The Texas Commission on Human Rights Act (TCHRA) applies to employers with 15 or more employees. Smaller businesses still have federal FLSA and other obligations.
